vision.notes: Likely used for general awareness and prey detection. Some species inhabit montane forests and rivers, suggesting functional vision.

chemoreception.notes: Used for prey detection, mate recognition, and navigation in aquatic environments. Salamanders in general rely heavily on chemical cues.

mechanoreception.notes: Lateral line system present in larvae and some adults for detecting water currents and vibrations. Likely important for prey detection and predator avoidance.

electroreception.notes: No data available regarding electroreception in Hynobiidae.

audition.notes: Likely sensitive to substrate vibrations. While they lack a tympanic membrane, they can likely detect vibrations through their limbs and body.
